intro: Tapeinidium tenuius, commonly known as the slender tapeinidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. Tapeinidium tenuius is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
